channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SparseGNV: Generating Novel Views of Indoor Scenes with Sparse Input Views
item.description: We study to generate novel views of indoor scenes given sparse input views.

item.title: Segment and Track Anything
item.description: This report presents a framework called Segment And Track Anything (SAMTrack) that allows users to precisely and effectively segment and track any object in a video.

item.title: PVT-SSD: Single-Stage 3D Object Detector with Point-Voxel Transformer
item.description: The key to associating the two different representations is our introduced input-dependent Query Initialization module, which could efficiently generate reference points and content queries.

item.title: An Inverse Scaling Law for CLIP Training
item.description: CLIP, the first foundation model that connects images and text, has enabled many recent breakthroughs in computer vision.

item.title: HAHE: Hierarchical Attention for Hyper-Relational Knowledge Graphs in Global and Local Level
item.description: The global-level attention can model the graphical structure of HKG using hypergraph dual-attention layers, while the local-level attention can learn the sequential structure inside H-Facts via heterogeneous self-attention layers.

item.title: SalienDet: A Saliency-based Feature Enhancement Algorithm for Object Detection for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Unknown objects are one of the reasons that hinder autonomous vehicles from driving beyond the operational domain.

item.title: Active Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: We propose Forward-Looking Active REtrieval augmented generation (FLARE), a generic retrieval-augmented generation method which iteratively uses a prediction of the upcoming sentence to anticipate future content, which is then utilized as a query to retrieve relevant documents to regenerate the sentence if it contains low-confidence tokens.

item.title: HuManiFlow: Ancestor-Conditioned Normalising Flows on SO(3) Manifolds for Human Pose and Shape Distribution Estimation
item.description: Monocular 3D human pose and shape estimation is an ill-posed problem since multiple 3D solutions can explain a 2D image of a subject.

item.title: Improving Continual Relation Extraction by Distinguishing Analogous Semantics
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel continual extraction model for analogous relations.

item.title: A General Framework for Visualizing Embedding Spaces of Neural Survival Analysis Models Based on Angular Information
item.description: We then show how these visualization ideas extend to handling raw inputs that are images.

item.title: Backpropagation-Free 4D Continuous Ant-Based Neural Topology Search
item.description: Continuous Ant-based Topology Search (CANTS) is a previously introduced novel nature-inspired neural architecture search (NAS) algorithm that is based on ant colony optimization (ACO).

item.title: A First Look at LLM-Powered Generative News Recommendation
item.description: Personalized news recommendation systems have become essential tools for users to navigate the vast amount of online news content, yet existing news recommenders face significant challenges such as the cold-start problem, user profile modeling, and news content understanding.

item.title: A fast topological approach for predicting anomalies in time-varying graphs
item.description: In the past decade, a persistence diagram (PD) from topological data analysis (TDA) has become a popular descriptor of shape of data with a well-defined distance between points.

item.title: BanglaBook: A Large-scale Bangla Dataset for Sentiment Analysis from Book Reviews
item.description: The analysis of consumer sentiment, as expressed through reviews, can provide a wealth of insight regarding the quality of a product.

item.title: THUIR@COLIEE 2023: More Parameters and Legal Knowledge for Legal Case Entailment
item.description: This paper describes the approach of the THUIR team at the COLIEE 2023 Legal Case Entailment task.

item.title: Serial Contrastive Knowledge Distillation for Continual Few-shot Relation Extraction
item.description: Continual few-shot relation extraction (RE) aims to continuously train a model for new relations with few labeled training data, of which the major challenges are the catastrophic forgetting of old relations and the overfitting caused by data sparsity.

item.title: THUIR@COLIEE 2023: Incorporating Structural Knowledge into Pre-trained Language Models for Legal Case Retrieval
item.description: Legal case retrieval techniques play an essential role in modern intelligent legal systems.

item.title: Subword Segmental Machine Translation: Unifying Segmentation and Target Sentence Generation
item.description: We propose a departure from this paradigm, called subword segmental machine translation (SSMT).

item.title: A General-Purpose Multilingual Document Encoder
item.description: While a large body of work leveraged MMTs to mine parallel data and induce bilingual document embeddings, much less effort has been devoted to training general-purpose (massively) multilingual document encoder that can be used for both supervised and unsupervised document-level tasks.

item.title: Undercover Deepfakes: Detecting Fake Segments in Videos
item.description: In this paper, we present a deepfake detection method able to address this issue by performing both frame and video level deepfake prediction.

item.title: Collection Space Navigator: An Interactive Visualization Interface for Multidimensional Datasets
item.description: We introduce the Collection Space Navigator (CSN), a browser-based visualization tool to explore, research, and curate large collections of visual digital artifacts that are associated with multidimensional data, such as vector embeddings or tables of metadata.

item.title: InstructBLIP: Towards General-purpose Vision-Language Models with Instruction Tuning
item.description: In this paper, we conduct a systematic and comprehensive study on vision-language instruction tuning based on the pre-trained BLIP-2 models.

item.title: ParamNet: A Parameter-variable Network for Fast Stain Normalization
item.description: The feature of parameter variable ensures that our network has a sufficient capability for various stain normalization tasks.

item.title: A Fused Gromov-Wasserstein Framework for Unsupervised Knowledge Graph Entity Alignment
item.description: In this paper, we introduce FGWEA, an unsupervised entity alignment framework that leverages the Fused Gromov-Wasserstein (FGW) distance, allowing for a comprehensive comparison of entity semantics and KG structures within a joint optimization framework.

item.title: Thermal Bridges on Building Rooftops
item.description: Thermal Bridges on Building Rooftops (TBBR) is a multi-channel remote sensing dataset.

item.title: Neural Fine-Gray: Monotonic neural networks for competing risks
item.description: Time-to-event modelling, known as survival analysis, differs from standard regression as it addresses censoring in patients who do not experience the event of interest.

item.title: AfriQA: Cross-lingual Open-Retrieval Question Answering for African Languages
item.description: African languages have far less in-language content available digitally, making it challenging for question answering systems to satisfy the information needs of users.

item.title: WebCPM: Interactive Web Search for Chinese Long-form Question Answering
item.description: We recruit annotators to search for relevant information using our interface and then answer questions.

item.title: Data quality dimensions for fair AI
item.description: In this article we consider the problem of bias in AI systems from the point of view of Information Quality dimensions.

item.title: EfficientViT: Memory Efficient Vision Transformer with Cascaded Group Attention
item.description: Comprehensive experiments demonstrate EfficientViT outperforms existing efficient models, striking a good trade-off between speed and accuracy.

item.title: Domain Incremental Lifelong Learning in an Open World
item.description: Specifically, we dedicate task-level prompts to capture task-specific knowledge to retain high LL performances and maintain instance-level prompts to learn knowledge shared across input samples to improve the model's generalization performance.

item.title: SMATCH++: Standardized and Extended Evaluation of Semantic Graphs
item.description: For safer and enhanced alignment, we show the feasibility of optimal alignment in a standard evaluation setup, and develop a lossless graph compression method that shrinks the search space and significantly increases efficiency.

item.title: Long-Tailed Question Answering in an Open World
item.description: A retrieve-then-rerank frame is further introduced to select in-context examples, which guild the LM to generate text that express knowledge for QA tasks.

item.title: Self-Chained Image-Language Model for Video Localization and Question Answering
item.description: We show a comprehensive analysis, e. g., the impact of Localizer, comparisons of Localizer with other temporal localization models, pre-training/self-refinement of Localizer, and varying the number of keyframes.

item.title: Unsupervised Dense Retrieval Training with Web Anchors
item.description: Based on their commonalities, we train an unsupervised dense retriever, Anchor-DR, with a contrastive learning task that matches the anchor text and the linked document.

item.title: Auditing Cross-Cultural Consistency of Human-Annotated Labels for Recommendation Systems
item.description: Recommendation systems increasingly depend on massive human-labeled datasets; however, the human annotators hired to generate these labels increasingly come from homogeneous backgrounds.

item.title: Towards Scalable Adaptive Learning with Graph Neural Networks and Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Our model is a sequential recommender system based on a graph neural network, which we evaluate on a population of simulated learners.

item.title: Combo of Thinking and Observing for Outside-Knowledge VQA
item.description: Some existing solutions draw external knowledge into the cross-modality space which overlooks the much vaster textual knowledge in natural-language space, while others transform the image into a text that further fuses with the textual knowledge into the natural-language space and completely abandons the use of visual features.

item.title: Multi-Robot Coordination and Layout Design for Automated Warehousing
item.description: We show that, even with state-of-the-art MAPF algorithms, commonly used human-designed layouts can lead to congestion for warehouses with large numbers of robots and thus have limited scalability.

item.title: VƒÅrta: A Large-Scale Headline-Generation Dataset for Indic Languages
item.description: We present V\=arta, a large-scale multilingual dataset for headline generation in Indic languages.

item.title: Say What You Mean! Large Language Models Speak Too Positively about Negative Commonsense Knowledge
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have been widely studied for their ability to store and utilize positive knowledge.

item.title: HumanRF: High-Fidelity Neural Radiance Fields for Humans in Motion
item.description: To close the gap to production-level quality, we introduce HumanRF, a 4D dynamic neural scene representation that captures full-body appearance in motion from multi-view video input, and enables playback from novel, unseen viewpoints.

item.title: Summarizing, Simplifying, and Synthesizing Medical Evidence Using GPT-3 (with Varying Success)
item.description: Large language models, particularly GPT-3, are able to produce high quality summaries of general domain news articles in few- and zero-shot settings.

item.title: SHS-Net: Learning Signed Hyper Surfaces for Oriented Normal Estimation of Point Clouds
item.description: In this work, we introduce signed hyper surfaces (SHS), which are parameterized by multi-layer perceptron (MLP) layers, to learn to estimate oriented normals from point clouds in an end-to-end manner.

item.title: Towards Better Graph Representation Learning with Parameterized Decomposition & Filtering
item.description: Proposing an effective and flexible matrix to represent a graph is a fundamental challenge that has been explored from multiple perspectives, e. g., filtering in Graph Fourier Transforms.

item.title: Multi-Prompt with Depth Partitioned Cross-Modal Learning
item.description: In recent years, soft prompt learning methods have been proposed to fine-tune large-scale vision-language pre-trained models for various downstream tasks.

item.title: Similarity of Neural Network Models: A Survey of Functional and Representational Measures
item.description: Measuring similarity of neural networks has become an issue of great importance and research interest to understand and utilize differences of neural networks.

item.title: V2X-Seq: A Large-Scale Sequential Dataset for Vehicle-Infrastructure Cooperative Perception and Forecasting
item.description: Utilizing infrastructure and vehicle-side information to track and forecast the behaviors of surrounding traffic participants can significantly improve decision-making and safety in autonomous driving.

item.title: CosmoPower-JAX: high-dimensional Bayesian inference with differentiable cosmological emulators
item.description: We then consider a combination of three Stage IV surveys, each performing a joint cosmic shear and galaxy clustering (3x2pt) analysis, for a total of 157 model parameters.

item.title: Optical Aberration Correction in Postprocessing using Imaging Simulation
item.description: Due to the spatial variation in optical aberrations, which cannot be avoided during the lens design process, recent commercial cameras have shifted some of these correction tasks from optical design to postprocessing systems.
